intro: Voyria mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican rock cress, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in early spring.
